title: Something's Gotta Give
review: They should call this a com-rom because the first half is all comedy and the second half is all romance. This sort of film is always so brightly and flatly lit, and this is an extreme example of that, but at least it makes sense because they're in a $40 million beach house with a lot of natural light. I guess I like British rom-coms from the 90s, because I feel nostalgic about them and I understand the quirks of the middle class white people in them. But this is an american equivalent and I don't feel the same way. Is it normal to cut off someone's sweater like that? I just have no idea. One thing I did like was how incredibly early 00s it felt. They had low-waisted jeans, bucket hats, oval sunglasses, and Maroon 5. What a crazy time to be alive. Also I enjoyed seeing the old people use computers.
